    • Method Detail

      • bootstrap

        public static Scope bootstrap​(@NonNull
                              @NonNull BootstrapScope bootstrapScope)
                       throws BootstrapException
        Initializes the art-framework using the given bootstrap scope.

        Bootstrapping is only required by the root module that implements and ships the art-framework. Normal modules should not use this bootstrap method, but instead tag their class with @ArtModule and use the respective tagged methods (OnBootstrap, OnLoad andOnEnable) to load themselves into the scope.

        By default the module will be bootstrapped into its own scope. Use the bootstrap(BootstrapScope, boolean) method with true to bootstrap the global scope.

        Parameters:
        bootstrapScope - the bootstrap scope containing the bootstrap module used to start the bootstrap process
        Returns:
        the scope created by the bootstrap process
        Throws:
        BootstrapException - if an error occurred while bootstrapping the module

      • bootstrap

        public static Scope bootstrap​(@NonNull
                              @NonNull BootstrapScope bootstrapScope,
                              boolean global)
                       throws BootstrapException
        Initializes the art-framework using the given bootstrap scope.

        Bootstrapping is only required by the root module that implements and ships the art-framework. Normal modules should not use this bootstrap method, but instead tag their class with @ArtModule and use the respective tagged methods (OnBootstrap, OnLoad andOnEnable) to load themselves into the scope.

        Set the boolean switch to true to set the resulting scope of the bootstrap process as the global scope.

        Parameters:
        bootstrapScope - the bootstrap scope containing the bootstrap module used to start the bootstrap process
        global - true if the result scope of the bootstrap process should be set as the global scope
        Returns:
        the scope created by the bootstrap process
        Throws:
        BootstrapException - if an error occurred while bootstrapping the module

      • callEvent

        public static <TEvent extends Event> TEvent callEvent​(TEvent event)
        Calls the given event on all registered scopes.

        Use the EventListener to listen on events fired by this.

        Type Parameters:
        TEvent - the type of the event
        Parameters:
        event - the event that is called
        Returns:
        the passed event

      • load

        public static ArtContext load​(java.lang.String key,
                              java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> list)
                       throws ParseException
        Loads the given string list and tries to parse each line into a valid art object.

        Uses the provided storage key to store the data of the context and reference it in future uses. Make sure to pass in the same storage key for all loads that need to persist data across sessions.

        Use the resulting ArtContext to ArtContext.execute(Object...), ArtContext.test(Object) or listen ArtContext.onTrigger(Class, TriggerListener).

        Parameters:
        key - the unique storage key for this provided input
        list - the list of valid art that is parsed into an art context
        Returns:
        the parsed art context
        Throws:
        ParseException - if the parse operation of the input fails
        See Also:
        Scope.load(String, Collection)

      • load

        public static ArtContext load​(java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> list)
                       throws ParseException
        Loads the given string list and tries to parse each line into a valid art object.

        Use the resulting ArtContext to ArtContext.execute(Object...), ArtContext.test(Object) or listen ArtContext.onTrigger(Class, TriggerListener).

        Parameters:
        list - the list of valid art that is parsed into an art context
        Returns:
        the parsed art context
        Throws:
        ParseException - if the parse operation of the input fails
        See Also:
        Scope.load(Collection)
